definition: to come across/to run into/to meet/to hit
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: I met a lot of friends, a lot of people from a lot around the world.
sentences.chinese: 我碰到很多朋友，很多人，他們來自世界各地。

sentences.english: He was caught by an avalanche and was seriously concussed.
sentences.chinese: 他碰到雪崩，受到嚴重的腦震盪。

sentences.english: As it was dark, he stubbed his toe against the table leg.
sentences.chinese: 由於天暗看不見，他的腳趾碰到了桌子腳。

sentences.english: I met few people congenial to me in the department.
sentences.chinese: 在那個單位裏我沒碰到幾個意氣相投的人。

sentences.english: It was in the zoo that Xiao Yang met your sister.
sentences.chinese: 小楊昨天是在動物園碰到你妹妹的。

sentences.english: However, some people will meet with the problem of whether they should read selectively or extensively.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些人會碰到應該選讀還是泛讀的問題。

sentences.english: She avoids big-ticket clothing items in case they may be counterfeit — as well as anything edible.
sentences.chinese: 她不買高價服裝以免碰到假貨，還有喫的東西。

sentences.english: Lily runs into her in the stairwell one day.
sentences.chinese: 一天，李莉在樓梯間偶然碰到新拌進來的女孩。

sentences.english: North and south, directly go to photography floor to find m blue, just small stone.
sentences.chinese: 南北直接去攝影樓找米藍了，剛好碰到小石頭。

sentences.english: Take care to avoid to put your fingers on polished surface.
sentences.chinese: 小心避免安裝時別將手指碰到閥內磨光面上。

sentences.english: i hope something will bring you to new york soon so that i can reciprocate your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 但願不久您能有機碰到紐約來，使我能答謝您的美意。

sentences.english: Clove encounter on the way home, orb said pearl.
sentences.chinese: 丁香在回家的路上碰到寶珠，寶珠說珍珠事了。

sentences.english: I said I answer it because I get the question every single day. Literally.
sentences.chinese: 我說我回答是因爲我每一天都會碰到這個問題。

sentences.english: "At least 50 of them must have passed us," says Ramirez.
sentences.chinese: 拉米雷斯說“我們至少碰到了50名。

sentences.english: Midian new business on the difficulties encountered.
sentences.chinese: 米店新開，營業上就碰到了困難。

sentences.english: There is another version of the pigeonhole principle that comes in handy.
sentences.chinese: 另外一種版本的鴿子洞原理遲早也能碰到。

definition: to meet/to run into/to come across
to run into/to come upon/to meet
to run into/to meet (unexpectedly)/to bump into
to appear/to arise/to emerge/to show up
on the road/on a journey/road surface
to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
